google_reviews.author: Skylar Smith
google_reviews.review: Sycamore Square building is awesome! The history is sooo much fun to learn about. I invite you all to go to "the creepy corner" and see if you feel anything/anyone with you...

google_reviews.author: Si H
google_reviews.review: Extremely unprofessional. Doesn't answer calls during business hours and didn't respond to voicemails. When we did get in contact with the company, we were met with very unfriendly responses, almost giving us the feeling that we were an inconvenience to the employees. We were told that we would get the apartment we applied for and heard nothing back for two weeks. Then we received an email saying they had given it to someone else, wasting our time which could have been spent looking for other places. If you are looking for a competent, trusted property management company please look elsewhere.

ownerResponse.text:
Hi Simon,
I'm so sorry that was your experience with us. Recently we did undergo a change in staff and property management. If you're ever looking into another apartment don't be afraid to call and set up an appointment. We'd love another chance to change your mind!

google_reviews.author: Steve Skippy Austin
google_reviews.review: Need to get their act together. Lawns are un kept and land shaping sucks. Parking lots need striping. Rent is prohibitive.

ownerResponse.text:
Hi Steve,
I'm so sorry about your experience. Recently we did undergo a change in management and staff. We appreciate your continued patronage! If there is ever another issue feel free to contact us personally, and we will do our best to rectify the situation!

Dear Jesse Graf,

We assume that based on this one star review of our management firm that you are displaying your frustration for the timeframe for repair of your back slider door at Briarwood Terrace Apartments.  

We do understand your frustration; however, please understand that glass companies are booked 6-8 weeks out, and the timeline for repair is outside of our control.  

Your glass door was not the only one which ended up broken due to a stray rock during landscaping, and we are doing our very best to get this repaired.  

We ask that you look for better ways to communicate your frustrations to our office other that resorting to petty reviews.
Thank you for your review! We are pleased to serve our tenants and owners!

yelp_reviews.author: Monica R.
yelp_reviews.review:
Sycamore Square

The famous beautiful brick building on the corner of 12th and Harris in Fairhaven was built in 1890 and still charms tourists and visitors alike. Make sure to reserve a whole afternoon to spend at this unique indoor shopping community. 

Stroll through Sycamore Square and find a wide variety of shops, restaurants, spa services, with 12th Street Shoes, Mambo and The Black Cat being among the most famous. What a  unique building to dine, browse and shop in Bellingham. Many professional offices round out this beautiful space. Big plus with plenty of parking (which is tough to find sometimes in Fairhaven) Sycamore Square owns the  parking lot on the corner of 13th and Harris.

summary.text:
Good

In the realm of aesthetics and historical charm, Sycamore Corporation's properties, particularly the Sycamore Square building, receive praise. Patrons appreciate the opportunity to immerse themselves in history, citing the building as an exemplar of heritage preserved in the modern age. This unique indoor shopping community garnered positive responses for its array among shops, restaurants, and professional offices. Moreover, the convenience of ample parking—a notable feature in a space like Fairhaven—is frequently mentioned as a commendable aspect of the property.

Additionally, from the user reviews, customer experiences in the Sycamore Square are often described as pleasant outings. The beauty of the brick building and the variety it offers seem to delight visitors who recommend reserving time to explore the mix of retail and dining experiences. Such feedback underlines the corporation's ability to maintain an environment that enhances the local neighborhood and attracts positive attention.

Great

Exceeeding expectations on the front of customer satisfaction, elements of Sycamore Corporation's service have been celebrated. Specific user reviews mention the "creepy corner," which seemingly offers an intriguing, paranormal twist to Sycamore's charm. Customers acquainted with these features find them to be a unique and fun aspect of their experience, suggesting the company has a knack for creating memorable experiences that go beyond the norm of property management.

Further emphasizing the great, the customer service has been noted to engage with the community, providing personalized responses to complaints and reviews. When issues are raised, there is evidence of the company’s attempt to address and resolve these concerns, showcasing a willingness to listen and improve. This responsiveness indicates that Sycamore takes its service seriously and strives to maintain a high standard of customer care.

Bad

Despite some positive feedback, Sycamore Corporation has not entirely escaped criticism in its property management practices. A common theme in user reviews is unprofessionalism; customers have reported instances where calls are not answered during business hours and voicemails are left without response. Additionally, some have felt that their interactions were less than friendly, creating an impression that inquiries and transactions were burdens on the staff. Such reports are damaging to the company's reputation for customer service.

Moreover, there have been references to miscommunications regarding tenancy applications, where promises of apartments were made and subsequently broken without timely notification. This has led to potential tenants experiencing frustration and inconvenience as they missed out on other housing opportunities. These activities reflect poorly on Sycamore Corporation's organizational efficiency and reliability.

Ugly

The "Ugly" aspects of Sycamore Corporation revolve around the physical state of the properties and the contentious interactions with tenants. Reviews have highlighted issues like unkempt lawns and inadequately maintained parking lot striping, suggesting a lack of attention to property maintenance. Furthermore, some user reviews suggest an excessive rent price that does not align with the quality of the environment provided, a serious concern for current and prospective residents.

In some of the less favorable user reviews, a tenant described experiencing significant delays in repair work, particularly for a glass door damaged during landscaping. The response which the company provided implied that the tenant’s review was petty, a clash that denotes tension between the company’s perspectives on feedback and customer expression. This is indicative of a particularly strained tenant-management relationship that overshadows the more positive aspects of the Sycamore Corporation's operations.
